fullText: Ms. Comer delivers a stunning, deeply felt performance that commands attention throughout this demanding 100-minute solo show, even when the play itself feels overly schematic.
dtliExcerpt: Ms. Comer delivers a stunning, deeply felt performance that commands attention throughout this demanding 100-minute solo show, even when the play itself feels overly schematic.
bwwExcerpt: Ms. Miller’s drama—the title is Latin legalese for “on the face of it”—arrives in New York trailing accolades, including Olivier Awards for best play and best actress, for its London run. High expectations can occasionally lead to disappointment, particularly as “Prima Facie” is opening in the fray of a busy Broadway spring season. Not so here. This urgent drama about the legal and emotional brutalities women often endure when they file charges of rape, particularly against a friend, lover or even husband, strikes home with scalding power.
showScoreExcerpt: Ms. Comer delivers a stunning, deeply felt performance that commands attention throughout this demanding 100-minute solo show, even when the play itself feels overly schematic.
